greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of primes p with p < n such that n^(p-1) == 1 (mod p^2) i.e., number of Wieferich primes to base n less than n.
link: Felix Fröhlich, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..9999
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{p = Complement[Prime@ Range@ PrimePi@ n, First /@ FactorInteger@ n]}, Select[p, Divisible[n^(# - 1) - 1, #^2] &]]; Length /@ Table[f@ n, {n, 2, 120}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Sep 24 2015 *)
program: (PARI) for(n=2, 120, i=0; forprime(p=1, n, if(Mod(n, p^2)^(p-1)==1, i++)); print1(i, ", "))
results.author: _Felix Fröhlich_, Mar 11 2015
